Both Kintetsu Railway and JR Railway have lines running through Kyotanabe. From
, it takes about 25 minutes by express train to reach Shintanabe Station on the

. From Nara, it takes about 23 minutes to reach Kyotanabe.

The
. Some of the trains originate from even further away in
Most travelers will find the trains to be the most convenient way to reach Kyotanabe. Nevertheless, there are buses connecting Kyotanabe to other cities.
has buses that come and go from Kyoto Station and Osaka's Namba Station to
in the northern part of Kyotanabe.

There are car rentals available near Shintanabe Station.
Biking is a good way to explore Kyotanabe since the sites are spread out. Bike rentals are available near Shintanabe Station for just ¥300 yen per day (electrical assistance bikes for ¥500). The bike rental is open from 8AM to 8PM.

For those only going to Ikkyuji, the Ikkyu Sanchi Road is a nice walking course. The road is an attraction itself with 15 Ikkyu

cards with interesting facts about Ikkyu scattered along the road, so you can learn about Ikkyu as you walk to his temple. They're only in Japanese, but non-Japanese may still enjoy the images and they are good indicators that you're going the right direction.

value: content=The Kirara Shotengai is dedicated to the city's mascot, Kirara-chan, a cheerful girl with rainbow pigtails. Along with restaurants and other shops, the shotengai has the Kirara no Eki, which is where you buy Kirara-themed souvenirs. You can also get some information about the town and purchase other local souvenirs. Across the street at the butcher shop is where you can buy the Kirara Croquette, as well.

Kyotanabe is known for its eggplants and

(bamboo shoots). The Kyotanabe Roll is a popular dessert that showcases the local tea.

In addition, there are a few snack foods inspired by Kirara, the town mascot. They are the Kirara Croquette and Kirara Bread, both of which can be found along the Kirara Shotengai.
, a high-quality type of green tea.
Due to its position between the large tourist cities of
, there are no hotels in Kyotanabe itself. If you do not want to stay in those cities or you want to be closer to Kyotanabe,
has a couple hotels as does

.

The only overnight option here for visitors is

, an Internet-Manga Café located in the "Station Park" walkway just across the street from Shintanabe Station. You can stay from 8PM to 4AM for ¥1543 or for 10 hours for ¥2057. You can shower for about ¥400.
